reviewText:
To gamers who wants to try this game. Please 'o' please don't listen to these imbaciles giving a negative reviews of a proper racing simulator.

Starting things off, there is currently no way you could enjoy a proper racing game without investing time to set it up first. Look at those negative reviews, they barely even scratched the iceberg with 0.2/0.5 hours of gameplay?
I've been playing a lot of racing simulators so I know my way around setting it up.

Now, ehem, this game is a lot for a free game. Heck you get all 4 licensed for not a single penny! They put a lot of effort in this game, especially in the FBB I love how it feels, how the car slides, how you lose grip when you hit a curb. The graphics is by far descent. I'm playing with n i3 and a GTX750 and I can run it max, talk about optimization. The AI is just wonderful, clearly a large amount of effort was put into this. (Now I think you're saying why are they saying the AI is bad? Well did you actually think those players are good? Food for thought)

Bottom line I say, if you have a gaming steering wheel you got to try this out. I know you have interest in simulations since you looked this up, I know too you are more capable than these fools that complains just about everything.

And to the Devs, well done sirs and madams well done.

reviewText:
I actually don't get it why this game has mixed reviews! Only %68 why? The game is free, actually completely free. it has better ai then Assetto Corsa for gods sake. I hope this game gets good reviews and updates.
If you have questions Ask me below :)

Pros It has wheel setups, choose your wheel and game helps with the setup.
It has decent AI drivers. (After many many many updates Assetto Corsa still doesnt have good ai drivers at all)
Cars are fun to drive.
Can use the stick shifter and shifting light for G27. (After many many many updates Assetto Corsa still cant use the shifting light!)
Couple tracks + Couple cars.
Optimized good. Can run the game at max 1080p60fps easily!
Decent simulation - racing game.
Cons Graphics are a bit old. i actually dont care that much
I cant make it show the map in race mode
Brakes seems to be overpowered. Cars can slow down suprisingly fast.
Engine sounds etc. lets say not the best but still playable :)
Edit: Pros and Cons edited for easier reading.

reviewText:
As soon as I loaded this game up, I knew exactly what I was in for. Developed by Reiza Studios, the same folks behind the excellent Game Stock Car 2013 (Extreme now) and Formula Truck 2013 series of games, this is pretty much the same thing, but on the Brazilian stock car circuit. While not familiar with the Brazilian circuit myself, I thoroughly enjoy the aforementioned games, and anyone else that is familiar with those will feel right at home as well. This is mainly the reason that I am able to write this review with such little play time on this at the moment!

So on to the gameplay! Once you're behind the wheel of either of three different car manufacturers (for now anyway), you'll see the familiar gMotor 2 engine used with these games, from the HUD to the ever-so-lovely shift/rpm gauge. Of course, these can be turned off (thankfully), which gives you a more realistic sim experience, if that is your cup of tea. And yes, you can change the view from the default cockpit! This is found in the Options > Display menu. There are a multitude of other settings that can be changed as well, from the number of cars seen on-screen at once to graphical settings. Most gamers with mid to high range machines can naturally max out these settings, as the graphics are not quite up to the same standards as Asetto Corsa and the likes. But, to me anyway, they look pretty good right out of the box, so to speak. This can also be said for the car handling physics, which are the same as other entries from Reiza Studios. And that is to say that they are some of the best that I have experienced in any racing game to date. Again, those that have played the games I mentioned know what I am referring to.

In summary, if you've played the other games Reiza has offered, you know what you're in for, and will feel right at home once you're in the game. If you're even remotely interested in racing games that are more of a simulation, then you should definitely give this a try. And heck, even if you don't like racing games, give it a try anyway. After all, how can you go wrong with a free game, especially one of this magnitude. What are you waiting for, add it to your Steam library right now!!!

reviewText:
An awesome simulation racing game but you arcade racers out there better buckle up too. Why? Because you can adjust the options to turn this into an arcade racer! So for everything I have tried in this game including the night time racing I would have to give it a 10/10 I mean its not that often you get a game this extensive that is ACTUALLY FREE! You read that right FREE meaning NO MICROTRANSACTIONS! The devs deserve the rightful praise of this game because of what they have done.

Thank you if you read this review in its entirety.

reviewText:
This is an amazing Racing Simulator. The controls are quite nice and smooth, even with my crappy old racing wheel. Graphics are OK, they aren't PS4 standards... They feel... 2010'ish, but still pleasing to look at, it works for what it is quite well. The customization and options are unbeliveble! You can change a lot of stuff to your liking, even on the camera, it's the first racing game i've seen that you can adjust the angle of the third person camera, its really neat!

The game suffers a little bit on the HUD department tho, kinda barebones and there isn't a map, like other racing games usually have (unless it's hidden on some option menu i havent found)... also, the menus aren't the most intuitive and user-friendly, you will have to spend some time to fiddle with the options to find what you need, but when you get everything set up to your controller, it will be a blast!

Some people seem to have problem playing with the keyboard, but since i played with a racing wheel, i cant say... even tho the game has a lot of options, with some patience, you probably can make any controller work fine!

If it had multiplayer i would gladly pay for it, it's a really nice game!

reviewText: This is a good game although you might not understand why. Reiza is the studio behind the title and they are well respected in the sim racing world. They're up there with iRacing, RaceRoom, Assetto Corsa, and PCars. The game is based off the Game Stock Car Extreme simulation engine, it's simulation not arcade, and that's a good thing. The engine is dated visually but Reiza keeps brining it along with new physics and features and, honestly, it looks half decent. The full game, including test days, practices, qualifying, full races with full AI grids, etc., is completely free. I honestly think Reiza should charge $5-10 for this package and it would still be well worth it. It took me a few minutes to setup my wheel in the controls, just be sure to do that first. Enjoy the game!

reviewText:
First it's free, so if you like Racing sims, I cannot think of a good reason not to download this.

Second, not only is it free, it is also very well put together - fully customizable control options, excellent FFB, and great car handling and physics.

There are unbelievably some negative reivews - I can only assume they are from arcade gamers who do not want to spend any time properly setting up their controls and other settings, or are still at school and have not yet learnt to appreciate what it means to actually have to earn money to pay for a game, and therefore what it means to get a game for free.

All I cans ay is, if you can not afford to buy a race sim, then this one may have less cars and tracks than other full release sims, but it will give you a simulation of racing that is as enjoyable as any of them.

It's also a recommended taster for Stock Car Extreme, which has many more cars of equal or higher quality.

reviewText:
Overall, it's a 6.5/10

I can see it was at least inspired by GTR2, as it shares a lot of design choices. But it just falls short when compared.
There are 4 different cars in the entire game, each with 2 different liveries. But they all feel the same.
there are also 6 different tracks in the entire game, each with it's own feel to them. Nothing bad to say here.
Options have been made well, there's a lot to change, controls, audio, display, and also difficulty of the game and rules of the races.

And then there's the driving physics. None of these cars have ever spun on me, even with every driving assist off. They just feel as if they were FWD, is that supposed to be that way? Other than that, clutch works, brakes do lock, and You do lose control in certain situations, but it's way too easy.
Same goes to the rival AI, once passed they do nothing to get their position back, and even before You pass them they seem like they were just moving obstacles on the road.

Graphics are... not that bad actually, the contrast etc is fairly well balanced, but everything else is just not there. True, there are working real-time shadows of the cars and the track but... that's it. No real-time car reflections, they're just reflecting the skybox (which isn't any good either, just about 20 small clouds on the sky), no motion blur, no depth of field, nothing! It's the middle of 2015, what were you thinking?
Sound is nice, You can hear everything happening around You, Cars do sound a little different but that's it, nothing spectacular again.

Long review short, it's an average game when compared to other racing simulators" out there
recommended: it's a good way to get into "arcade-simulator racing" as I call it. There aren't many cars to master
hoursPlayed: and they all feel the same so it's not a huge hop to change a car
voteText: the tracks aren't too hard to master
helpfulPercent: the AI isn't too hard and unforgiving
votesHelpful: etc etc.\n\nSo if You're new to the simulator genre
votesTotal: have an old computer which can't run modern games and a steering wheel do get it. It's for free so You can find out if You're going to like simulator racing or not. But if You do
votesFunny: please do get GTR2 and find some mods for it because that is the best way to get into "hardcore simulator racing". It's from 2005 so Your PC will run it
commentsCount: and it has a damn well written physics engine."

reviewText:
(First review, sorry!)

This is a racing sim, probably one of the best free-to-play racing sims.
I've played this for almost an hour, and for most of it, I couldn't figure out the controls. I've pressed every button my keyboard, testing things out, and couldn't get my car to actually start. The control panel had what seemed like MILLIONS of controls, and would be very hard to remember them all, especially if you don't play often. I've fixed my controls though, and finally started to drive.

I turned off gasoline useage, tire ware, etc. so I could get used to the driving. Even with the fixed controls, the car was still very hard to control, and since some of the maps have a lot of twists and turns, I crashed often, or slowed down, and the AIs caught up, thus me ending up in 10th place in 10 minutes, even with a map I chose with only a couple of turns. Everytime I got back onto the track after crashing into the walls, I'd sometimes get hit with a passing AI, ending in me crashing AGAIN. Sometimes this cycle would repeat 2 or 3 times. Other than that, I had a lot of fun racing, and hope to soon get better as I play more.

Pros:
- Graphics are decent
- Sound is awesome (in my opinion at least)
- Beautiful car details
- Free to play
- Runs on slow computers
- Perfect game for if you don't have a lot of money
- No lag
- Replays are cool

Cons
- Hard to drive
- Music is annoying
- No tutorials
- Controls are like wow

Overall, I will give this a game a 6/10 and I recommended you give it a try if you like racing games.

reviewText:
Copa Petrobras de Marcas is a game based on the well-known rFactor engine by ISI, and that is a big thing in this game: this engine is known for its lifelike physics simulation, tons of customisation options and modding features. The result is that the game offers a solid, reliable driving experience similar to games such as GTR and F1 Challenge 99-02, though in a different scenario: Brazilian racecars and circuits, recreated with great attention to detail - thanks Reiza Studios!

It is important to notice that, as a serious race simulation, the game requires a steering wheel if you want to enjoy what it has to offer. Graphics are a bit outdated, but the overall driving experience, the sound and the detailed models make up for it. On the other hand, the game doesn't require a Master Race desktop setup.

If you're Brazilian, you know what to expect. If you're not, it's chance to know some tracks popular in Ayrton Senna's country, and take some popular vehicles such as the Focus, the Lancer and the Corolla for a drive. In the real competition, these cars are equipped with a similar engine and a fixed ratio gearbox (this aspect was thoroughly recreated in the game).

Most importantly, Copa Petrobras de Marcas is free to play. Not the microtransaction type, it is actually free! Great driving model, accurate vehicles and tracks, realistic sound and a highly competitive AI for free - quite a deal, aye?

reviewText:
This is a good racing game. The physics are believable. Even though they are not very detailed, they are sufficient for this game.

More importantly, this game allows you to map your inputs freely, like any game that respects the player does.

also, there is none of this modern steering dampening" nonsense where your gamepad is supposed to feel like a wheel that only turns slowly.

No
date: this game respects you and your inputs. it doesn't mess with your steering curvature.\n\nand the in game wheels are moving in sync with your controller and as fast as you can move the controller. I wish every racing game controlled like this."

reviewText:
Copa Petrobras de Marcas is an OK game, not too great. It's free, so I can't say much too bad about it. The default controls are different than in most games, so if you don't change them from the beginning, you will be driving way off. There are many cool things about this game- pitstops, gauges and meters, while tracking tires and other things. Also, you can change the camera views in different ways than in most games (i.e. side mirrors).

-Pro: You can choose different variations of the Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution X from the start.
-Con: No multi-player mode.

reviewText:
This is a great racing SIMULATOR and i really enjoy it. I really wasnt expecting it to be as good as it really is but trust me, if you have a ffb wheel you got to give this a try.


PROS

-The A.I is REALLY good, its one of the few A.I´s i actually enjoy racing.

-Decent amout of tracks

-Good physics

-Good rolling starts

-You pretty much get a complete racing simulator for FREE

CONS

-Not a lot of cars, but it have the cars it needs

-Can be a little bit tricky to get started with the settings



And for you who complain about the keyboard controllers, this was made for force feedback wheels and not kb/m controlls

reviewText:
Sim Players are passionate when it comes to driving, flying or even riding the vehicles that have either thrilled and amazed us during our childhood even still do today which is why we take time out to write great reviews .. so I’d just like to add something to that ……
It’s always a shame to read about the disappointments that a fellow Sim Player has experienced instead of reading about their delights as they have taken the controls of their favourite consist and proudly taken passengers or goods from their chosen station, port or yard and delivered them on time having faced realistic challenges of schedules, other transport or sometimes signal failures and adverse weather conditions - that inner sense of achievement (and self-pride) is all we really seek - Yes they may be after all only simulations of real modes of transport –BUT…. be it an incredible landing of a fully laden 300 ton Boeing 747-400 on a real time flight from Singapore to Heathrow - Microsoft Flight Simulator perhaps - where you take care of the Jumbo's flight deck and using the array of true to life switches, levers and dials as you descend gently down to terra firma – EGLL runway 21 to be exact to the [imagined] sounds of cheers and applause of your satisfied passengers and crew. Or that inner voice that says 'yees!' when we finally arrive at the depot and park up our Flexi-Bus for the day OMSI 2– its late, the sun has set, both outside our windows (if we care to look!) and within the Sim… but we don’t care.. We’ve driven with diligence and skill, we’ve hit n hurt no one and managed to pick up and drop off everyone without a hitch… that’s what matters.. That’s why we play these Simulators –
That’s what Sims do for us! - They fulfil our innermost desire to be a part of something that we admire, to take control of the very vehicles that we venerate and are in awe of – Hours of our lives are spent recreating the paths taken by Road, Rail, Air and Sea in order that we may share the experience in some intangible way of that of the Driver, Pilot, Captain, Fireman, Soldier and Doctor? within us all – all this achieved speedily at the flick of a mouse button and without the arduous years of universities, specialist training and professional advice and preparation, we will not suffer any loss of limb if we make mistakes as we learn the art of take-off and landing, nor will we face litigation and inevitable imprisonment from the families of the loved ones that we lost at sea due to our lack of experience of sailing cruise ships, or even suffer from docked wages from South West Trains for continued late arrivals at London Victoria… Friends our desire and task is a simple one … to Simulate through our chosen modes … without the Wind, Rain, Ice, Snow or Insurance Costs ever affecting or view of our chosen destination -
To Dream the Impossible is what drives the human spirit – But to deny someone of that dream is to deny them of the very lust for life ….. So keep dreaming keep ‘Simming’ and whether it’s by Air, Sea or Land may your journeys be filled with fun, passion and excitement –
Sim on! n Smile as you go!

reviewText:
PEOPLE GIVING MARCAS A NEGATIVE RATING MUST BE COMPLETELY BONKERS OR COMPLETELY SIMPLE...JUST DISGUSTING TO SEE THIS FINE FREE SIM RACER GET A MIXED REVIEW!

If you are on a tight budget - there is simply no better sim racer you can find with such a complete single player championship experience, only raceroom experience comes close.

There is absolutely no reason for people who are into racing not to like what Copa Petrobras de Marcas has to offer FOR FREE. The only reason this game is free is because Brazil's largest oil company Petrobras is paying the bill. Marcas is a promotional game built on a quality sim engine, by people who know how to make this engine shine better than the original programmers.

You get a FULL TC championship, with the same great handling that comes with Reizas Game Stock Car series.

If you have a FFB steering wheel you are in for a treat, as Reiza's Stock Car series has been universally recognized as having one of the best driving models in the business. The graphics are crisp and functional, without unnessessary eye candy (check SweetFX*), so the game can be played on most mid range machines at the highest graphical settings.

I was actually happy that the Marcas content was recently added to the Stock Car Extreme game, as it is one one my favorite Reiza classes to drive - being front wheel driven they require a different style. FWD is another detail some negative reviews seem to miss when they discuss handling.

As for the comment on driving views - there are many camera views (!), in and outside the car.

Before posting negative reviews, take a little time to check the set up possibilities, controls etc, and you'll find that almost anything can be set up. Same for FFB, it can be tweaked to near perfection. At best any negatives given on these issues show a lack of looking for the proper settings - read stupidity of the reviewer.

Most of the negative comments seem to come from people who are expecting an arcade racer, with basic one size fits all ez mode, game pad support, game pad friendly handling and eye candy" visuals.

Unfortunately by doing so they completely miss the point - as non target audience of this game - and trash the game accordingly.

Pearls before swine I'm tempted to say.....

The graphics are GOOD
recommended: instead of the on steroids Michael Bay kind you find in most arcade racers.\n\nGet a good FFB wheel
hoursPlayed: take some time to set up this game - my Logitech Driving Force GT requires NEGATIVE FFB to work correctly
voteText: you have to know that and deal with it. These are really essential requirements
helpfulPercent: just like installing the SweetFX* shaders to get optimal visuals.\n\nLearn how to drive with the free copa game and soon you'll be buying Stock Car Extreme for all its other classes and tracks. Want something really different
votesHelpful: get Formula Truck.\n\nI own the original non-Steam versions of Reizas games
votesTotal: including the older GSC2012 - still cool
votesFunny:
still on the hdd and I still play them.

Summery
- arcade racers move on (please
commentsCount: and stop reviewing)\n- get a good ffb wheel (essentiel with race sims)\n- take some time to tweak your settings (also essentiel
column16:
no one size fits all in sims)
- install SweetFX (...some eye candy)
- have fun RACING (the whole point)
- give Marcas and Reiza some well deserved love!

*The post processing effects you see in videos and screenshots are not standard
column17: but can be easily installed. SweetFX - takes less the a couple of minutes to set up.\n\nhttp://www.racedepartment.com/downloads/sweetfx-reiza-settings-for-gsc-extreme-formula-truck-2013.3482/"

reviewText:
There will be people who will say I didnt spend long enough ingame to have a valid opinion however, I am a serious sim racer. I`ve been playing sim games for many years now, gtlegends, rfactor, race07, iracing and rfactor2, i`ll even spout I own what I would class as arcade racers ie shift 1,2 dirt 1,2,3 f1 2010 etc etc....

My setup does not involve a joypad if your gonna play a sim then buy a wheel its that simple, I love my g27.

Onto Copa

Graphics: the gfx are poor for a game this recent, a mediocre laptop could run this at full whack and not suffer.
Sound: music was ok in menu, car sounds suck massive unicorn wang! meaning they are the worst Ive ever heard.
control: wheel setup was easy, the cars feel very unrealistic even running on veteran settings.
Online: is there an online? i dunno it was uninstalled after about 10 mins.

conclusion: If your a serious sim racer avoid this game at all costs you will be nothing but disappointed with it even given the fact that its free. If your an arcade racer then I spose its ok but my 2 cents would say to look elsewhere for arcade racers, I would even recommend the original Grid game over this. The only plus` I can give this game is the inmenu music and the ui is easy enough to navigate.

So all being said serious sim racers not wanting to spend money on iracing dont get this lol,,, do yourself a favour and get rfactor2 or even race07, you will have far more fun with those titles... now excuse me while I load up rfactor2 and go hit nord in autumn on full HD with the nissan gtr :) nuff said,,, avoid copa unless your an arcade racer!!!!!

reviewText:
Briefly.

CONS

1) defualt assist settings mean the car drives itself effectively. Just remember when to lift at the end of the straights.

2) change the assists and the car still tries to steer itself a little in the corners. Set the FFB to above zero and you can feel it. at +50% (yes it is possible to have -50%) you end up fighting the wheel to strighten up to the line out of the corners.

3) if you don't like the bumper view the camera options are horrible

4) I tired interlagos for 20 minutes. At the end of the pit straight the braking markers on the right side are missing and with the camera view it is impossible to judge the braking distance. I did 10 laps and went off every time.

5) Although it has many defualt wheel configs they all need to be customised and it's not immediately obvious how you do it.

Pros

1) race 07/rfacetor engine.

2) defualt setup for the evo (only car i tried) is good. very grippy and stable.

3) free

Conclusion

If you are new to racing games. This is one to try. It will help teach you the racing lines and how a car should feel before you dive into something like LFS/ Race 07/Asstto Corsa. If you have any experience, it's best to avoid unless you want an easy game to play while drinking and driving but the Need For Speed games exist for that purpose.

reviewText:
Copa Petrobras de Marcas.

Is this a fun game? Yes.

Is this a multiplayer game? Sadly no.

Would it be worth paying 10 bucks for if it wasn't free? No.

The reason why it's not worth 10 bucks is because it's only singleplayer, and you can only race a couple of track.

And there aren't that many cars. So no, it's a fun game. But not worth much money.


But that's why it's free, do I recommend it??? Ummmmm. Well, for the racing itself yes. And if your gonna get this game, that's probably what your into.


But for the game itself? Nope. It's good as a free game but look at Trove for an example of what a great free game is (it's not even constricting, you don't need to buy anything even though it does have microtransactions).



Now I know I clicked the No" on the "Do you recommend this game" thing. But here is the thing
date: I wouldn't recommend it for the lack of features
recommended: not for the racing. So if your not bothered by this then go and get it. The racing is great
